oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Superconductivity and possible overdoping in Lu1-xCaxBa2Cu3O7-delta
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GNANASEKAR, KI
SHARON, M
PINTO, R
TAMHANE, AS
PURANDARE, SC
PAI, SP
GUPTA, LC
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: copper-oxide superconductors
cuprate superconductors
structural anomalies
high-tc
temperature
system

y1-xluxba2cu3o7-delta
chemistry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Structural and superconducting properties of the system Lu1-xCaxBa2 CU3O7-delta, both in bulk as well as thin film form, have been investigated. Presence of large Ca-ions at the Lu-sites is responsible for phase stability (in 1-2-3 phase) in bulk. In argon annealed tetragonal samples (delta:1) superconductivity is reinstated as in these samples, presence of Ca-ions lead to the generation of holes in the Cu-O planes. In oxygen annealed bulk samples and thin films, there is a large depression of T-c due to divalent Ca-ions present in concentration x < 0.2. Our data indicate that this depression of T-c is likely due to overdoping effect.
